user_input: How many programmes are offered under the Bachelor of Computer Science?
expected_response: There are six programmes offered: Computer System and Network, Artificial Intelligence, Information Systems, Software Engineering, Multimedia Computing, and Data Science.

user_input: When should Computer Science students start their industrial training, and how long is the duration?
expected_response: You should start your industrial training in Semester 1 of Year 3. The training should at least 24 weeks. If less than 24 weeks, the student does not fulfil the requirement of the Industrial Training programme and will fail his or her Industrial Training.

user_input: What grading system is used in FCSIT?
expected_response: FCSIT uses UM's grading system. Grades include: A = 4.00, A- = 3.70, B+ = 3.30, B = 3.00, B- = 2.70, C+ = 2.30, C = 2.00, C- = 1.70, D+ = 1.30, D = 1.00 (conditional pass), and F = 0.00 (fail). Refer to page 97 for details.

user_input: Who is the Deputy Dean for Undergraduate studies?
expected_response: The Deputy Dean (Undergraduate) is Associate Professor Dr. Norisma Idris.

user_input: Who is the Head of Department for AI?
expected_response: The Head of the Department of Artificial Intelligence is Dr. Erma Rahayu Mohd Faizal Abdullah.

user_input: What is the course code for Data Structure?
expected_response: The course code for Data Structure is WIA1002.

user_input: Are there any programming courses in the first year as an Artificial Intelligence student?
expected_response: Yes, you will learn the basics of programming in your first year through courses like Fundamentals of Programming and Data Structures.

user_input: How long is the Computer Science programme?
expected_response: The Computer Centre offered a four (4) years Bachelor of Computer Science programme.

user_input: How many academic projects are required in the final year?
expected_response: You will have Academic Project I and Academic Project II.

user_input: What courses should I take in Year 1 Semester 1 for the Computer Science (Artificial Intelligence) programme?
expected_response: In Year 1 Semester 1, you will take: GIG1003 (Basic Entrepreneurship Culture), GLTXXXX (English for Communication 1), WIX1001 (Computing Mathematics I), WIX1002 (Fundamentals of Programming), WIX1003 (Computer Systems and Organization), and WIA1007 (Introduction to Data Science)

user_input: How long is the Bachelor of Pharmacy (Hons) programme?
expected_response: The programme spans 4 academic years.

user_input: What are the total credits required in Year 1?
expected_response: In Year 1, you are required to complete 36 credits.

user_input: Can I take a foreign language instead of English Communication?
expected_response: Yes, students with MUET Band 5 or 6 may choose a Foreign Language Course instead of English for Communication.

user_input: What is covered in the Anatomy and Physiology course?
expected_response: The course covers the human body’s structure and function including major systems like cardiovascular, respiratory, nervous, and others, and explains homeostasis.

user_input: Who is the coordinator of the Mobility Programme?
expected_response: DR. ASFARINA AMIR HASSAN is the Coordinator of Mobility Programme. Her email is asfarina_amir@um.edu.my.

user_input: Can you provide the list of foreign language courses available?
expected_response: Here is a list of Foreign Language Courses: BASIC KOREAN LANGUAGE 1, BASIC KOREAN LANGUAGE 2, BASIC PORTUGUESE LANGUAGE 1, BASIC PORTUGUESE LANGUAGE 2, BASIC RUSSIAN LANGUAGE 1, BASIC SPANISH LANGUAGE 1, BASIC THAI LANGUAGE 1, BASIC THAI LANGUAGE 2, BASIC TURKISH LANGUAGE, BASIC VIETNAMESE LANGUAGE

user_input: How can I appeal against my examination results?
expected_response: You may appeal against your examination results, including continuous assessment and/or final exams, within seven (7) days from the official result announcement. You must complete the university’s prescribed appeal form and submit it to the Dean of the Faculty along with a copy of the payment receipt. A non-refundable processing fee is required. Appeals will not be accepted if submitted late, incomplete, or without proof of payment. Upon receiving a valid appeal, a second examiner will be appointed to review the assessment together with the original examiner. The final decision will be made by the Faculty Appeals Committee and approved by the Committee of Examiners.

user_input: What are the graduation requirements for the Bachelor of Pharmacy (Hons) programme?
expected_response: To graduate, a student must: (a) achieve a final CGPA of at least 2.00; (b) complete all prescribed credit hours for the programme; (c) meet the Faculty's specific requirements; (d) fulfill university language requirements; and (e) comply with any other requirements set by the Senate. At least two-thirds of total programme credits must be taken at the University of Malaya. A student must also complete the minimum duration of study unless exceptions apply. A Bachelor’s Degree With Honours is awarded upon meeting all conditions. A Pass With Honours (With Distinction) is awarded if the student earns a final CGPA of 3.70 or above, has no failed or repeated courses, and completes the programme within the minimum or approved duration.

user_input: How many credits are required for the pharmaceutical industry and regulatory control course?
expected_response: 6 credits are required for the pharmaceutical industry and regulatory control course.

user_input: Who is the Head of the Department of pharmaceutical chemistry?
expected_response: DR. HEH CHOON HAN is the HEAD of department of pharmaceutical chemistry.

expected_response: The Head of the Department of Electrical Engineering is Assoc. Prof. Dr. Anis Salwa Mohd Khairuddin.

user_input: How many total credits are required to complete the Bachelor of Electrical Engineering?
expected_response: Students must complete a total of 137 credit hours to graduate.

user_input: What courses I need to take in the first semester?
expected_response: In Semester I, first-year students take Philosophy and Current Issues (or Malay Language Communication), English Communication I, Engineering Mathematics I, Digital System, Programming I, Circuit Analysis I, and Lab 1.

user_input: What is the course code for Engineering Mathematics 1?
expected_response: The course code for Engineering Mathematics 1 is KIX1001.

expected_response: You can contact the Faculty of Engineering at at fk_tdhep@um.edu.my. Tel: +603 7967 7621 for general inquiries.

user_input: Who is the deputy dean for Department of Electrical Engineering?
expected_response: The Deputy Dean (Undergraduate) is Associate Professor is Assoc. Prof. Dr. Raja Ariffin Raja Ghazilla.

user_input: What is the course information for the course Human-Computer Interaction?
expected_response: KIE4032: Interaksi Manusia-Komputer / Human-Computer Interaction, Course Code: KIE4032, Course Title: Human-Computer Interaction, Credit: 2, Medium of Instruction: Bahasa Inggeris

user_input: What are the learning outcomes of the course Signals and Systems?
expected_response: At the end of the course, students are able to: 1. Apply suitable transform technique for continuous-time and discrete-time signals. 2. Apply suitable signal representation technique in signal and system by taking into account various considerations. 3. Compare the input-output relationship of signal in written report or presentation.

user_input: How many credit hours are there for the course Circuit Analysis I?
expected_response: The course Circuit Analysis I has 3 credit hours.

user_input: What are the prerequisites for the course Optimization Methods?
expected_response: The prerequisites for the course Optimization Methods is KIE3005 (Numerical Analysis).

user_input: What information do I have to include when applying for “Special Consideration”?
expected_response: You must complete the form. You should have supporting documents from an appropriate professional authority, i.e., a registered medical practitioner or counsellor if you are unwell, OR submit a signed and witnessed Statutory Declaration or a police report form where you have experienced a misadventure. If these sections are not completed properly, your “Special Consideration” form will not be accepted.

user_input: Who is the Head of Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology
expected_response: The Head of Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology is Professor Dr. Mukhri Hamdan.

user_input: How long is the MBBS programme?
expected_response: The MBBS programme is a five-year programme.

user_input: What are the student societies that I can join?
expected_response: The student societies you can join are: 1. Medical Society (MEDSOC) 2. BioMedical Science Society 3. Nursing Science Society (NurSoc).

user_input: When are the final examinations scheduled for Term I?
expected_response: The final examinations for Term I are scheduled for 27 November - 8 December 2023.

user_input: What is the course structure for the MBBS programme?
expected_response: The structure of the UMMP is a matrix of Stages (Time) and Themes (Curriculum content). UMMP is divided into the following Five Courses (Stages). MIA 1001: Medical Sciences 1 (Stage 1), MIA 2001: Medical Sciences 2 (Stage 2), MIA 3001: Practice of Clinical Medicine 1 (Stage 3.1), MIA 4001: Practice of Clinical Medicine 2 (Stage 3.2), MIA 5001: Practice of Clinical Medicine 3 (Stage 3.3).

user_input: Is accommodation provided for MBBS students?
expected_response: All undergraduate students will be provided with on-campus accommodation managed by the Student Affairs Division (HEP). The Ibnu Sina (Sixth) Residential College equipped with three (3) blocks for male students and five (5) blocks for female students able to houses about 700 Faculty of Medicine’s students.

user_input: What does the Pre-Internship Term (PRINT) involve?
expected_response: The Pre-Internship Term (PRINT) is the last eight-week component in the UMMP for students towards the concluding part of the MIA 5001: Practice of Clinical Medicine 3 (Stage 3.3) course. It is designed to help prepare you for some of the practicalities of internship. You will undergo an orientation a week prior to PRINT on essential aspects of your transition into the medical workforce. The weeks are spent in clinical attachments. You are responsible for your own learning, but you are required to complete some performance assessment tasks in which you are assessed by your supervisor. The supervisor will commit at an agreed time to help you in your preparation for the assessment.

user_input: Are there opportunities for encountering patients during the programme?
expected_response: Yes, from the first week of Stage 1, students spend one day each week in UMMC or CSU where you learn communication skills, systematic history taking and physical examination techniques. Early clinical contact is a feature of the UMMP.

user_input: What is the Pt-Dr Theme?
expected_response: The Pt-Dr Theme covers the clinical aspects of health and disease, both theoretically and from a practice perspective. It encompasses the diagnosis and assessment of patients through history taking, physical examination and the use of other investigations; communication skills; the management of clinical problems; basic procedural skills; and the identification and application of research-based evidence in health care practice (evidence-based medicine, abbreviated EBM).

user_input: Who is the Music Programme Coordinator for Undergraduate?
expected_response: The Music Programme Coordinator for Undergraduate is DR. WANG I-TA

user_input: What are the graduation requirements for the Bachelor of Music programme?
expected_response: To complete the Bachelor of Music degree, students must earn a total of 127 credits. This includes 14 credits for University Courses, 7 credits for Faculty Core Courses, 82 credits for Programme Core Courses, 8 credits for University Elective Courses (SHE), 3 credits for Faculty Elective Courses, and 13 credits for Programme Elective Courses.

user_input: What is the contact information for the faculty's student affairs?
expected_response: For further enquiries on Student Welfare Matters within faculty: Contact Person: Dr. Premalatha Thiagarajan Deputy Dean (Undergraduate & Student Affairs) Email: premalatha@um.edu.my Puan Rohaizan Ramli Senior Assistant Registrar Email: rohaizan@um.edu.my Encik Mohd Hairil Anuar Bari Cultural Officer Email: asbari@um.edu.my

user_input: Am I required to take an English course if I got Band 5 in MUET?
expected_response: Students with band 5 and 6 of MUET are given the option to take either a English Communication Course or a foreign language course.

user_input: What is the course code for the course Dance Technique I?
expected_response: The course code for Dance Technique I is RIC1008.

user_input: What is the course description for the course Introduction to Music Education?
expected_response: This course aims to introduce students to well-known music education approaches such as Orff, Kodaly, Dalcroze, Suzuki and others as well as expose students to active involvement in teaching activities. Students are required to plan, implement and report on programs or projects that they have selected. All the different levels are planned together in groups and implemented at selected areas. Students are required to produce a full report based on the school project carried out and present the report.

user_input: What courses should I take in Year 1 Semester 1 for the Drama programme?
expected_response: In Year 1 Semester 1, you will take: GIG1013 (Appreciation of Ethics and Civilizations), GLTXXXX (English for Communication 1), RIB1002 (Drama Appreciation), RIB1003 (Vocal Technique), RIB1007 (Malaysia Traditional Theatre), RIB1009 (Theatre Technology) and RIB1010 (Movement Technique in Theatre).

user_input: How long is the Bachelor of Performing Arts programme?
expected_response: The Bachelor of Performing Arts programme is a three-year programme, consisting of six regular semesters (each 14 weeks long) and one special semester (7 weeks).

user_input: Is Industrial Training required for the Bachelor of Drama programme?
expected_response: Yes, Industrial Training (RIB3022) is required for the Bachelor of Drama programme.

user_input: Who is the Drama Programme Coordinator?
expected_response: The Drama Programme Coordinator is RAJA FARAH RAJA HADAYADANIN.
